  • India's Coronavirus Cases Cross 3 Lakh-Mark: 10 Points

  • Shakti Kapoor Says He Won't Let Daughter Shraddha Resume Filming Just Yet

  • To Keep Yamuna Clean, Delhi Government To Give Free Sewer Connections

    Press Trust of India | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    The Delhi government on Friday said it will provide free household sewer connections to ensure that no untreated sewage flows into stormwater drains.

  • Delhi Gate Cemetery Running Out Of Space As COVID-19 Death Count Rises

    Press Trust of India | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    With a rapid incline in the number of deaths due to COVID-19, the New Cemetery for Muslims at Delhi Gate is under stress and may have no space left for burials by the end of June, a member of the graveyard's management committee said today.

  • Coronavirus: Dehi High Court Fines Law Student Rs 20,000 Over Plea To "Gain Publicity"

    Press Trust of India | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    The Delhi High Court today said the Central government's decision of phased reopening of lockdown was not taken in haste and it was done to ensure a proper balance between containing the spread of COVID 19 pandemic and making it certain that people are not forced to starvation.

  • Delhi To Vote On June 24 To Elect Mayors Of 3 Municipal Corporations

    Press Trust of India | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    Polls to elect mayors and deputy mayors of the three corporations in Delhi are slated to be held on June 24, officials said on Friday.

  • Increasing Bed Capacity Should Be Delhi's Top COVID Priority: Lt Governor

    Press Trust of India | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    Lt Governor Anil Baijal on Friday said ramping up bed capacity and medical resources should be the topmost priority in handling the COVID-19 situation to ensure that a surge in coronavirus cases does not overwhelm the city's healthcare system.

  • "Beware Delhi": Gautam Gambhir Slams Arvind Kejriwal Over COVID-19 Spike

    Edited by Divyanshu Dutta Roy | Friday June 12, 2020, Delhi

    BJP MP Gautam Gambhir on Friday lashed out at the Aam Aadmi Party government in Delhi over the coronavirus situation in the capital, saying that Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal is more interested in passing the buck than taking steps to arrest the alarming surge in cases.

  • "Delhi Situation Horrendous": Supreme Court Blasts State Over Hospitals

    Reported by A Vaidyanathan, Edited by Swati Bhasin | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    Coronavirus patients are being treated "worse than animals", the Supreme Court said today as it pulled up the Delhi government over the "horrendous, horrific and pathetic" situation in the national capital amid a spurt in cases.

  • "Lockdown Will Not Be Extended": Delhi Minister Amid Spike In Virus Cases

    Reported by J Sam Daniel Stalin,Sukirti Dwivedi, Edited by Deepshikha Ghosh | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    The coronavirus lockdown will not be extended in Delhi, the city government said on Friday, rubbishing speculation after a spurt in virus cases over the past few days.

  • Delhi Man Found Hanging From Tree, Murder Suspected

    Press Trust of India | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    The body of a man was found hanging from a tree in west Delhi's Ranhola area, police said on Thursday.

  • We Will Try To Get More Doctors, Medical Staff: Delhi's Heath Minster Satyendar Jain

    Press Trust of India | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    Emphasising that COVID-19 is the biggest tragedy of the century, Delhi Heath Minster Satyendar Jain on Thursday said it is a "war-like situation" and the city government will try every means to get more doctors and medical staff to meet the requirements.

  • BJP Wants To Play Politics Over COVID-19 Deaths In Delhi: AAP's Sanjay Singh

    ANI | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh on Thursday alleged that BJP wants to play politics over deaths due to COVID-19 in the national capital.

  • Delhi Government Issues SOPs For Its Offices To Prevent Spread Of Coronavirus

    Press Trust of India | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    With COVID-19 cases reported from some of its departments, the Delhi government on Thursday issued a set of standard operating procedures (SOPs) prescribing elderly employees and pregnant women to be kept off frontline duties to ensure they are not exposed to any risk.

  • Need Of Hour That Private Hospital Be Permitted To Test For COVID-19: Delhi High Court

    Press Trust of India | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    The Delhi High Court on Thursday said it was need of the hour that all private hospitals equipped with labs to test for COVID-19 and having ICMR sanction for the same be permitted to conduct the test for the coronavirus.

  • Delhi High Court Forms Panel To Examine Utility Of Using 2 Hotels As COVID Hospitals

    Press Trust of India | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    The Delhi High Court Thursday constituted a committee of doctors, including AIIMS Director Randeep Guleria, to visit two luxurious hotels to examine the feasibility of using them as extended COVID hospitals.

  • Delhi Police Attacked By Aides Of 2 Arrested For Loot, Assault: Cops

    Press Trust of India | Friday June 12, 2020, New Delhi

    A policeman was injured after associates of a man and his two brothers, who were arrested on charges of looting and assault, threw stones and fired on a police post's personnel in north Delhi, officials said on Thursday.
